channel.title: The Taiwanese Table
channel.description: Explore Authentic Asian Flavors, No Passport Required

item.title: Cucumber Salad in 5 minutes
item.dc:creator: jennylo2477
item.content:encoded:
Looking for a refreshing side dish in summer? You're at the right place!

Let's make a cucumber salad in 5 minutes!

Ingredients: (for 1-2p)

  • Cucumber
  • 1 tablespoon of Soy Sauce
  • 1 tablespoon of Black Vinegar
  • 1 tablespoon of Chili Oil
  • Some Sesame Oil
  • Some Sesame Seed
  • 1-2 cloves of minced Garlic
  • 1/3 teaspoon of Salt
  • 1/3 teaspoon of Chicken Power (optional)
  • 1 Red Chili (optional)

Steps:

  1. Cut the cucumber into small cubes
  2. Add Soy Sauce, Black Vinegar, Chili Oil, Garlic, Salt, Chicken Power
  3. Add cucumber into the sauce and mix well
  4. Dress with some Sesame Oil and some Sesame Seed on the top
  5. Enjoy!

Notes:

  • If you like it a bit sweet, you can add 1/3 teaspoon of sugar
  • Feel free to adjust the level of spiciness by reducing/adding chili oil and fresh red chili

item.title: Taiwanese Fried Chicken
item.dc:creator: jennylo2477
item.content:encoded:
Fried chicken is a must-try street food you'll find in ever corner in Taiwan. It can never go wrong.

Ingredients: (for 2 people)

  • 1-2 Chicken Thighs (boneless)
  • 1 Egg
  • 1-2 cloves of minced Garlic
  • 1 teaspoon of Salt
  • 3 teaspoons of Sugar
  • 1 teaspoon of Soy Sauce
  • 1/3 teaspoon of White Pepper
  • 1/3 teaspoon of Five Spice Power
  • 1 tablespoon of Rice Wine
  • 1/2 Lemon Juice
  • Sweet Potato Flour
  • Flour
  • Salt & Pepper Powder (optional)

Let's get started!

  1. Slice the chicken in to half from the side and make some cuts/scratches on the surface to break the muscles
  2. Pound both side of the chicken with the back of the knife to make it thinner
  3. For the batter: add Egg, Garlic, Salt, Sugar, Soy Sauce, White Pepper, Five Spice Power, Rice Wine, Lemon Juice into a bowl and mix well
  4. Add the chicken in the batter and give them a thai massage. Marinate for 3+ hours.
  5. Mix 2-3 tablespoons of Sweet Potato Flour into the batter before frying (the key to juicy fried chicken ‚ú®)
  6. Mix the Sweet Potato Flour with Flour (1:1) then make sure both side of the chicken is coated with the powder
  7. Set aside until the color turns brown and the coat is wet (so it sticks to the chicken!)
  8. Heat the oil till 160-170¬∞C (test the temperature by throwing a little piece of flour, when it immediately floats it's ready to fry)
  9. Add the chicken, let them fry for 2 minutes before flipping to the other side
  10. Take the chicken out when both sides turn golden
  11. Increase the temperature till 190-200¬∞C then add back the chicken
  12. Fry for 1 minute and... time to dig in!
  13. Season with some Salt & Pepper Powder (optional)

Note:

  • If you don't have potato flour you can also use normal flour
  • Don't make it too often so you don't gain weight üòâ

item.title: Spicy Dry Hot Pot
item.dc:creator: jennylo2477
item.content:encoded:
Home made Spicy Dry Hot Pot for one person in less then 30 minutes!

Ingredients:

  • 125-250g Korean Rice Cake (tteokbokki)
  • Tofu
  • 1/2- 1 Fish Cake
  • Enoki Mushroom
  • Water Spinach

The idea is to add whatever you like, not limited to the ingredients mentioned above. I also like to put sliced potatoes, fried tofu skin and sliced beef :)

Seasoning

  • 1 minced Garlic
  • 2 pieces of sliced Ginger
  • Some Onions
  • 1 Red Chili (optional)
  • 1 piece of Green Onion (white part)
  • Some Green Onion (green part)
  • Some Sichuan Pepper (optional)
  • 1 ChongQing Hot Pot Base

Let's get started

Temps total: 30 min

  1. Prepare the seasonings and cut all the ingredients into bite size

2. Blanch all the ingredients

3. Filter out the water

4. Heat up some oil, add Garlic, Ginger, Red Chili, Green Onions (white part), Onions and cook till the aroma comes out.

I am using my favorite Lemon Oil (recipe here) today, you can also skip this step by adding the Hot Pot Base.

5. Add 1/4 of Hot Pot Base and cook till the red oil melts.

I like to add some Sichuan Pepper for more flavor.

6. Add back all the ingredients and mix well (be careful of the burning oil ‚ö†Ô∏è)

7. Top with some Green Onion (green part), some Sesame Seeds and some Sesame Oil.

8. Enjoy!

item.title: Salmon Sushi, Sashimi & Pok√© Bowl
item.dc:creator: jennylo2477
item.content:encoded:
Craving for Japanese food? With 4 ingredients you can have a sushi party in home with friends and family!

Ingredients for 2 people

  • 2 cups of Sushi Rice
  • 4 tablespoons of Sushi Vinegar
  • 2 teaspoons of Sugar
  • 1/3 teaspoon of Salt
  • Nori
  • 140g Salmon
  • 1 Avocado

Teriyaki Sauce

  • 1 tablespoon of Sugar
  • 2 tablespoons of Mirin
  • 3 tablespoons of Soy Sauce
  • 4 tablespoons of Water
  • Garlic
  • White Sesames

Sushi Rice

  1. Add 1-2 cups of Sushi Rice and 1-2 cups of water in the rice cooker. Rice : Water = 1 : 1 or 1 : 0.9
  2. Add Sushi Vinegar, Sugar and Salt into a pot, cook with low heat without boiling the liquid
  3. Transfer to a wooden bowl, if not a glass bowl also works. Flip and stir the rice with the side of the spoon to make it fluffy
  4. Add half of the Sushi Sauce, mix well before adding the second half
  5. Set aside for later use

Sushi Nigiri

  1. Wet the hands with water so the rice won't stick
  2. Take some rice and shape it with your palms (don't smash it!)
  3. Put one piece of sliced salmon on the top of the rice, squeeze a bit so they don't fall apart
  4. Great! You just did the first one!

Salmon & Avocado

  1. Slice 1/4 of the Avocado for maki and 1/4 into cubes for Pok√© Bowl
  2. Sharpen the knife
  3. For Nigiri, Instead of cutting vertically, tilt the knife to slice
  4. For Pok√© Bowl, cut the salmon into cubes
  5. For Maki, cut the salmon into long strips

Once the preparation is done, we can start putting them together!

Sushi Maki

  1. Spread the rice evenly on the Nori
  2. Add sliced Avocado and stripe Salmon or whatever you like on the rice
  3. Put some rice on the top of the nori. The purpose is to stick the nori together
  4. Roll up the sushi by wrapping all ingredients in the first move
  5. Make sure it's tight and everything is wrapped
  6. To cut the sushi roll, the knife has to be VERY sharp
  7. Wipe out the rice on the knife after 2-3 cuts

Pok√© Bowl

  1. Transfer the Rice, Salmon and Avocado into a bowl
  2. Add Sugar, Mirin, Soy Sauce and Water into a pot and boil till the sauce is thick
  3. You can also add some Garlic while making the sauce
  4. Drizzle the sauce on the top and dress with some White Sesames

P.S. If there's some salmon left, make them into sashimi

Enjoy!
item.excerpt:encoded: This recipe guides readers on how to make sushi at home using four main ingredients - sushi rice, salmon, avocado, and teriyaki sauce, for a variety of sushi-based dishes.

item.title: Chow Mein/Fried Noodles
item.dc:creator: jennylo2477
item.content:encoded:
Chao Mein is my ultimate comfort food. It reminds me of the noodles my grandma used to lovingly prepare for me at home.

Sometimes if I've got some leftover ingredients in the fridge, I'm whipping up a plate of those nostalgic noodles.

Ingredients

  • 1 package of Ramen noodles/ Udon
  • 1 Garlic (minced)
  • 2 sliced of Ginger
  • Half of the Onion
  • 1 Red Chili (optional)
  • Chili Oil (optional)
  • 1 Green Onion (separate the green & white part)
  • Cabbage
  • 1/3 Zucchini (chopped)
  • Tofu
  • Sesame Oil
  • White Sesame Seed

Sauce

  • 1 teaspoon of Sugar
  • 1 tablespoon of Black Vinegar
  • 1 tablespoon of Oyster Sauce
  • 2 tablespoons of Soy Sauce
  • 2 tablespoons of Water
  • 1/3 teaspoon of White Pepper
  • 1/3 teaspoon of Chicken Powder (optional)

Let's get started!

  1. Sauce: add all the ingredients into a bowl and mix well. Save it for later use.
  2. Chop all the veggies into bite size (or the size you prefer).
  3. Heat the oil, add Garlic, Green Onions (white), Ginger, Red Chili and cook till the aroma release.
  4. Add your veggies and cook for 2-3 minutes until they are soft. Then add tofu.
  5. Add noodles. I cut the noodles into 3-4 pieces so it's better to stir.
  6. Add the Sauce, Chili Oil (optional) mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes.
  7. Drizzle with some Green Onions (green), some White Sesame Seeds and some Sesame Oil
  8. Transfer into a plate and enjoy!

Note: for vegetarian version, replace the oyster oil with vegetarian oyster oil. Or just simply skip this step :)

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Chow Mein/Fried Noodles | Nouilles Saut√©es aux L√©gumes

item.title: Spring rolls with Shrimps
item.dc:creator: jennylo2477
item.content:encoded:
Indulging in delicious food while on a weight loss journey?

Absolutely! Enter the world of spring rolls, where the fusion of three vibrant vegetables and a wholesome protein source creates a tantalizing delight.

Experience the perfect blend of sour and spicy, freshness and lightness that not only satisfies your taste buds but also ignites your appetite.

And here's the best part ‚Äî besides being a treat for your palate, spring rolls make cleaning up a breeze. Say farewell to the hassle of scrubbing greasy dishes and utensils, making it a win-win for your taste buds and your kitchen cleanliness.

Ingredients: for 2

  • 6 pieces of sliced Cucumber
  • Some Carrots/Avocado
  • 3 pieces of Salad/Cabbage leaves (slice half)
  • Some Vermicelli
  • 12 pieces of Shrimps (slice half)
  • 6 pieces of Rice Papers

Sauce:

  • 1.5 - 2 teaspoons of Sugar
  • 2 tablespoons of Vinegar
  • 2 tablespoons of Fish Sauce
  • Some Garlic
  • Some Onions
  • Some Red Chili (optional)
  • Some Lemon Juice
  • 5-6 tablespoons of Water

Let's get started!

  1. Cucumber: cut the cucumber into long and slender strips. After removing the inner part, divide the cucumber into three equal portions. Add some salt and let it marinate for 30 minutes, then wash away the salt for 2 to 3 times.
  2. Sauce: mince or slice the garlic, onions and red chili (optional). Add fish sauce, lemon juice, sugar, white vinegar and water in a bowl, blend well.
  3. Vermicelli: bring a pot of water to a boil and cook the vermicelli until they achieve the perfect tenderness. After draining the hot water, cool down the vermicelli with cold water.
  4. Veggies: whether it's carrots, avocados or veggies of your choice, slice them into thin strips. Cut each piece of the salad leaf into half and remove the stem in the middle.
  5. Shrimps: slice them in half. I usually put 4 sliced shrimps in each roll.
  6. Assemblage - step 1: dip the rice paper into water, put half a piece of salad at the bottom as a base. Layer on a piece of cucumber, carrots and vermicelli. Put 4 pieces of sliced shrimps around one-third of the rice paper from the top.
  7. Assemblage - step 2: wrap all the ingredients starting from the bottom in one fluid motion. Tuck in both sides, continue rolling until the shrimps are securely enveloped, make sure nothing falls out.
  8. How to eat: dip your spring roll into the previously prepared sauce before every bite. Enjoy!
item.excerpt:encoded: This post provides a recipe for a weight-loss friendly dish - Spring Rolls. The rolls comprise cucumbers, carrots, avocados, salad leaves, vermicelli, and shrimp, wrapped in rice paper. They are served with a zesty homemade sauce. Besides being flavorful, spring rolls simplify kitchen cleanup. Enjoy a guilt-free, seamless cooking and dining experience.

wp:postmeta.wp:meta_value: Spring Rolls with cucumbers, carrots, salad, vermicelli and shrimp. Enjoy a guilt-free, seamless cooking and dining experience.
Spring rolls with Shrimps - weight loss friendly

item.title: Sesame Oil Chicken Rice | È∫ªÊ≤πÈõûÈ£Ø
item.dc:creator: jennylo2477
item.content:encoded:
Cozy up to the winter vibes with the ultimate comfort food ‚Äì Sesame Oil Chicken Rice! This Taiwanese street food classic is all the rage, especially when the temperature takes a dip to around 17¬∞C to 18¬∞C without a heater in home!

A steaming bowl of Sesame Oil Chicken Soup or a plate of Sesame Oil Chicken Rice will totally do the trick, warming you up from the inside out. It's like a hug for your taste buds in chilly weather! üç≤üî•

Ingredients:

  • Chicken Thights (recommand) or Chicken Breast
  • 5-8 pieces of sliced Ginger
  • 4 Shiitakes
  • 4 tablespoons of Sesame Oil
  • 4 tablespoons of Olive Oil
  • 1 bowl of Rice Wine
  • Salt
  • White Pepper
  • Green Onions

Let's get started!

  1. Cut the chicken into bite size
  2. Marinate the chicken with some salt, white pepper and rice wine; coat every piece of chicken with some oil
  3. Soak the mushrooms in water for 20 minutes until they are soft
  4. Squeeze out the water (save the water!) and cut the mushrooms into bite size
  5. Cook the chicken. If you're using chicken thights, put the skin in the bottom and cook with low to medium heat, until the chicken oil releases and the skin is dry and crispy.
  6. Set the chicken aside for later use
  7. Add Olive Oil, Sesame Oil and sliced Ginger. Cook with low heat (important!). The sesame oil will become bitter if the fire is too high
  8. When the ginger turns dry and curvy, add the mushrooms and chicken. Cook till the aroma release.
  9. Add rice, mushroom water and 1 bowl of rice wine. Boil for 2-3 minutes before transfering into the rice cooker.
  10. Add some water just to cover all the ingredients (if needed)
  11. When the rice cooker is done, drizzle with some Green Onion and it's time to dig in!
item.excerpt:encoded: Indulge in the Taiwanese comfort dish Sesame Oil Chicken Rice when the temperature drops. This hearty meal, perfect for chilly weather, warms you from the inside out. The recipe features marinated chicken, mushrooms, and a fragrant mix of oils and spices, creating a cozy dining experience. Follow the simple steps in the video to enjoy this winter delight!
